intro: Stenanthemum mediale, commonly known as the narrow-leaved stenanthemum, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and is often found growing in sandy or rocky soils. It is a shrub that typically reaches a height of around 30 to 60 centimeters. Stenanthemum mediale is adapted to dry environments and is often found in coastal or inland heathlands.
